item.title: [DRTRIGON-15] F53 (copied from wiki)
item.project: [migrated to bugzilla, do not use] DrTrigon's tools
item.description:
Id 25 (weiter unten) angehen und ...

  1. 'replace_tmpl.py' (für ''Individuelle Vorlagenersetz- und Bearbeitungsaufträge''): weiterentwickeln, hier ein Konzeptentwurf;
    • Befehle von max. 20 Ersetzungen können direkt ausgeführt werden, alles andere ''nur nach'' Simulation
    • Simulationen werden ausgeführt und das Resultat mit eindeutiger Id auf Ausgabeseite geschrieben, damit kann der Befehl (durch Angabe der Sim-Id) ausgeführt werden
    • In der Simulation werden alle relevanten Informationen gespeichert und bei Ausführung wieder eingelesen, so können problematische Einträge in der Simulationsausgabe noch modifiziert werden und der Bot nutzt einfach diese Angaben
    • Bei jeder Botbearbeitung wird der Name des Auftraggebers vermerkt
    • Simulationen sollten jeder Stunde, die Ersetzungen 1 mal pro Tag laufen
    • Resultate werden mit Verweisen zu ev. Fehlern oder Problemen auf Ausgabeseite zusammengefasst, zur Nachbearbeitung, falls es ein kleiner Auftrag war, oder die Anpassungen der Sim-Daten nicht ausgereicht haben
  2. 'sum_disc.py': Umstellung auf [1] (ev. 'getbacklinks_switch', 'globwikinotify_switch' u.a. weiter betreiben)
  3. 'subster.py': Kann eigentlich öffentlich werden, da mit der [2] jeder den Bot jetzt auch konfigurieren kann
  4. ev. auch mal kurz analysieren, was für ein Bot überhaupt sinnvoll ist, bzw. gebraucht wird?!; mal rumfragen ...

REPORTED: DrTrigon; 19:57, 20. Dez. 2009 (CET)

[1] http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProjekt_LiquidThreads
[2] http://toolserver.org/~drtrigon/cgi-bin/substersim.py

comments.comment: Instead of further developing 'replace_tmpl.py' make a wiki interface for 'replace.py'. This interface and 'replace.py' are a more generalized version of 'replace_tmpl.py'. Then implement special features e.g. for template replacement and others!
subster.py can also be used to update the used bot revision number in wiki.

replace_tmpl.py:

  • subclass replace.py (fixes.py) bot
  • subclass template.py bot
  • make wiki UI for the functions they provide!!
  • create specialized functions like in replace_tmpl.py!!

Another idea for a bot is given in: http://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Bots/Anfragen&oldid=77370441#Vorlage:FIFA-Rang_aktualisieren

This could be done by something very similar to subster.py and thus would be quite interesting.

Some other ideas for bot and toolserver scripts:

  • clean_user_sandbox.py:
    • subclass new clean_sandbox.py
  • irc_client.py:
    • look at articlenos.py and maintcont.py
  • DrTrigonBot - toolserver scripts:
    • look at rcsort.py
welcome.py: some wiki use it but dewiki has banned it. Look at http://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Benutzer:DrTrigonBot&oldid=80324642 for more info.

Does anyone already handle http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProjekt_Syntaxkorrektur by bot? Or is that considered as bad style (and not allowed)? Was there any discussion/talk about it already? (I was not able to find something...)

Talk with Merlissimo in IRC #wikipedia-de-bots answered the question:

(12:14:20) DrTrigon: Merlissimo: Hallo! Frage; Gab es schon Ueberlegungen oder Anfragen [[Wikipedia:WikiProjekt_Syntaxkorrektur]] wenigstens teilweise per Bot zu machen? Ich weiss nur von [[Benutzer:Xqbot]] der sich (zumindest früher mal) um fehlende <references /> tags kümmert...
(12:14:29) linky: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProjekt_Syntaxkorrektur?redirect=no
(12:14:37) linky: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benutzer:Xqbot?redirect=no
(12:15:18) Merlissimo: wird nicht gerne gesehen, dass massenhaft per bot zu machen
(12:15:56) DrTrigon: ...dachte mir sowas! aber konnte keine Diskussion dazu finden... Danke für die Info!
(12:17:03) Merlissimo: schau bei den abgelehnten botanträgen
(12:30:56) DrTrigon: Merlissimo: ...Du bist gut! Hab was gefunden unter [Wikipedia:Bots/Anfragen/Archiv/2008-2#Fehlerkorrektur_f.C3.BCr_WikiProject_Check_Wikipedia], [[Wikipedia:Bots/Anträge_auf_Botflag/Archiv/2008]] und [[Wikipedia:Bots/Anträge_auf_Botflag/Archiv/2009]]. Danke Dir!!
(12:31:05) linky: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Bots/Anfragen/Archiv/2008-2#Fehlerkorrektur_f.C3.BCr_WikiProject_Check_Wikipedia
(12:31:13) linky: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Bots/Antr%C3%A4ge_auf_Botflag/Archiv/2008?redirect=no
(12:31:13) linky: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Bots/Antr%C3%A4ge_auf_Botflag/Archiv/2009?redirect=no

Simply to do all those corrections IS considered bad style, thus forget it! To do some specific of thoses corrections e.g. <references /> tag (as done e.g. by Xqbot and AwOcBot) is ok... The question is which of those to do?!

script_wui.py added (instead of replace_tmpl.py) in r133. Is experimental and beta.

Supports replace.py, template.py and templatecount.py so far.

According to the ideas mentioned in DRTRIGON-93 (and http://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Benutzer_Diskussion:Grip99&oldid=92123510#Subster) following concept:

bot_control.py should have an additional operating mode (e.g. command line param "-ircrc") that runs all the time (has to be restarted by SGE in case of failures) and watches the IRC RecentChanges channel irc://irc.wikimedia.org#de.wikipedia. In case of a page changes the bot_control.py runs subster.py (as usual) in order to update the page. This would make the subster tags pseudo-dynamic (more dynamic than now). May be to simplify, only pages listed/enrolled on a special page are checked this way.

This would also avoid to increase the execution frequency of subster.py by use of SGE/cron(ie) since the bot would run all the time - this could open additional techniques (e.g. for panel.py or else) - but also give new issues...

Another idea for option/parameter handling:

http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benutzer:CopperBot/config.css

Set of bots is now given; the list of bots already running will get enhanced with 'script_wui.py' the WikiUserInterface. This will be the last bot planned - other might be possible - according to time available - but are not planned!
Support http://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Benutzer_Diskussion:Grip99&oldid=92230444#Subster.

Try to implement good Version numbers like described in

  • http://developer.pidgin.im/wiki/FAQAllInOne#Whatwillthenextversionbenumbered
  • http://semver.org/

Additionally clean-up the version handling (e.g. versions associated to tickets) to get a proper 'Release Notes':

  • https://jira.toolserver.org/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=10421&version=10231
  • https://jira.toolserver.org/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=10421&version=10232
Modified 'articlenos.py' code that can be inserted into 'bot_control.py' as ircbot mode for 'subster.py'. Should then be runned as long-running job and use SGE to re-start in case of errors.
LiquidThreads could or will become a topic later again. But this is just a small part...

[1] https://wiki.toolserver.org/view/Batch_job_scheduling

comments.comment: This is now not a feature only any more, we will have to do this as stated in http://lists.wikimedia.org/pipermail/toolserver-l/2010-September/003429.html

According to https://wiki.toolserver.org/view/Job_scheduling

The cron-jobs were converted to cron triggered scheduled jobs started with 'cronsub' and managed by the system automatically.

This is not obligatory yet but strongly recommended.

Due to http://lists.wikimedia.org/pipermail/toolserver-l/2011-January/003817.html all crontabs (cronie) were moved from user login server nightshade.toolserver.org to job submission servers submit.toolserver.org.

This should prevent future issues like the bot outage between Jan. 2. 2011 and Jan. 8. 2011 (look at contribs).

item.title: [DRTRIGON-10] B57 (copied from wiki)
item.project: [migrated to bugzilla, do not use] DrTrigon's tools
item.description:
Warum wird [1] auf [2] nicht gemeldet?!??

REPORTED: DrTrigon; 15:49, 22. Jun. 2010 (CEST)

[1] http://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Benutzer_Diskussion:DrTrigon&oldid=75810344#DOM
[2] http://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Benutzer:Merlissimo/SumDisc&oldid=75860994

comments.comment:
This was not reported because of the fact that I answered on 20. Jun. 2010 (CEST) to a posting from 20. Mai 2010 (CEST). Since Merlissimo is very active, my page was not on his recent changes anymore. Backlinks did not trigger, because of the fact that he uses 'Benutzer:Merlissimo/Sig' and 'Benutzer_Diskussion:Merlissimo/Sig' which are not in the backlinks list. Thus he should modify it to look like:

{ 'backlinks_list': [ u'%(userdiscpage)s', u'Benutzer:%(username)s', u'Benutzer:%(username)s/Sig', ] }
Thus 'backlinks_list' has to be published in next release! Look at r29: http://fisheye.toolserver.org/changelog/drtrigon/?cs=29
(switch close <-> resolve management)

comments.comment: Is an issue with '_parseNews'. To solve it; instead of the used string, the 'line' of the heading should be used as given by the new 'getSections' implemented to resolve DRTRIGON-25.

item.title: [DRTRIGON-8] B55 (copied from wiki)
item.project: [migrated to bugzilla, do not use] DrTrigon's tools
item.description:
http://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Benutzer_Diskussion:DrTrigon&oldid=68528974#getbacklinks_durch_DrTrigonbot_selbst_verursacht

REPORTED: Merlissimo; 20:42, 28. Dez. 2009 (CET)

comments.comment:
Following situation:

Page A (any page):

  • was edited by myself
  • after that was edited by Merlissimo and he is the last editor of the page at the moment of bot run

Page B (my bot output/report page; SumDisc)

  • Page A gets reported with Merlissimo as last reporter
  • any other page gets reported, thus Merlissimo's sign is not at the end

Page C (Merlissimo's bot output/report page)

  • Page B gets accidentally reported because of 'getbacklinks' !
Backlinks are at the moment also the most time consuming part during bot run. For some user there are > 3000 backlinks to process each run. This has to be solved.

Not solved but reduced the check frequency; will only be checked once a week... this should be sufficient, because this is not main source of info. It is thought to make the results complete and hold long term threads...

Changed again, since some accounts have > 6000 backlinks. Now the max. for 1 day a week is 2000. A nice thing would be to have a time sorted backlink list, but this is not possible since mw database holds no such data, or at least the API and framework do not return any.

Discussed with Merlissimo in #wikipedia-de-bots (irc). Since this bug does not appear that often, the solution was delayed till later. There is already some code implemented as possible solution, but not used (yet). A few things have to be considered:

  • autoexclude (DRTRIGON-32) by adding all other users result pages can cause problems for users discussing with each other (and using the bot) since this could break such notifications
  • another solution could be to change or suppress the signatures distributed by the bot
  • at the moment I'm believing the best solution is like for interwiki conflicts to solve such things by hand (and breaking the cycle by removing signatures)
Look also at r79: https://fisheye.toolserver.org/changelog/drtrigon/?cs=79

If this problem appears again, please RE-OPEN this ticket.

(the incomplete solution is the reason why it was just 'resolved' not 'closed' yet)

item.title: [DRTRIGON-7] B54 (copied from wiki)
item.project: [migrated to bugzilla, do not use] DrTrigon's tools
item.description:
Abschnitt mit nur sich ändernden Vorlagen erscheinen täglich neu: Fast täglich erscheint bei mir 'Discussion changed: Benutzer Diskussion:GregorHelms at Tagesseiten' obwohl der letzte Edit dort Anfang Oktober war.

[ in Arbeit: siehe [1]; ich denke es liegt an "!!! WARNING [2]: was not able to get Sections properly! Re-Reading Wiki page (mode='full') at Benutzer Diskussion:GregorHelms..." (bzw. [3]) und damit werden wohl die Vorlagen expandiert. Ist also das Symptom eines komplexeren Problems; die Seite enthält Ueberschriften in Vorlagen, d.h. ich MUSS sie expandieren, aber dann wird im Abschnitt 'Tagesseiten' auch immer der Text verändert, wegen 'timel: F/d'... Sehe zur Zeit 2 mögl. Lösungen; entweder den Text 'substen' damit er statisch wird, oder eine Funkt. in Bot einbauen, damit einzelne Einträge abgewählt/ausgeschaltet werden können. ]

REPORTED: Merlissimo; 11:38, 12. Dez. 2009 (CET)

[1] http://toolserver.org/~drtrigon/DrTrigonBot/20091213.log
[2] http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benutzer_Diskussion:GregorHelms
[3] http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benutzer_Diskussion:GregorHelms#Tagesseiten

comments.comment:
In the new bot revision (> r26) the templates on a page do not get expanded anymore. There are more than several reasons for doing so:

  1. the Page.get() and PreloadingGenerator do not expand templates, thus the content/wiki text is not read/available
  2. if a user edits the template (which is needed to have changed text within the included content), this edit and thus the template page appear on the users contributions list and will be checked separately (and are therefore ignored as includes)

It is very likely that this concept change will solve this problem also.

The new bot (> r26) uses a new page retrieval, without any template expansion at all.

If a similar issue appears for the new bot, please re-open this issue (or a new) with specific actual bot and page information.

Thanks a lot for reporting!
(switch close <-> resolve management)

item.title: [DRTRIGON-5] B52 (copied from wiki)
item.project: [migrated to bugzilla, do not use] DrTrigon's tools
item.description:
Zeitlicher Ablauf ist nicht mehr OK! ArchivBot läuft um 1:00 Uhr und dann um 3:00 Uhr und SpBot läuft um 3:00 Uhr - ist leider wieder so, dass beide 'vor' DrTrigonBot laufen, was eher suboptimal ist... Zusätzlich zum Zeitablauf auch einfach (wenigstens optional) alle Bot-Bearbeitungen ausblenden, bzw. wegfiltern; das würde das Problem allg. lösen.

[ sum_disc.py (_getLastHumanEditor), dtbext_wikipedia.py, dtbext_userlib.py (neu) ]

REPORTED: DrTrigon; 08:58, 25. Sep. 2009 (CEST)

comments.comment:
May be the other bots are now executed as cron batch job [1] and thus delayed a bit...?

[1] https://wiki.toolserver.org/view/Batch_job_scheduling#Running_jobs_from_cron

Merged in from 'pywikipedia-devel_0.2.0001_rev8072'.

Problem with timing ignored or better solved by bot cleverness - that way it's not that critical in what order the bots run. E.g. when using batch jobs or else, the order cannot be guaranteed!!
'_getLastHumanEditor' --> 'getLastEditor' solves the problem, but slows down the bot since for each result a API call may happen.
(switch close <-> resolve management)
